intro: Leucothea, commonly known as the white queen, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plants are characterized by their showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to blue. They typically grow in woodland or rocky habitats and are often found in moist, well-drained soils. Leucothea species are valued for their ornamental appeal and are sometimes cultivated in gardens.
